quests.title: Skill Forger
quests.description: Spend 30 minutes practicing a skill you want to improve. Mastery is built one focused session at a time.
objectives: Choose one specific skill to practice
Track what you learned or improved
tips: Quality practice beats quantity every time
Break complex skills into smaller components
Celebrate small improvements along the way

quests.title: Achievement Chronicler
quests.description: Write down 3 things you accomplished today, no matter how small. Recognition starts with self-awareness.
objectives: Write them down with specific details
tips: Include small wins - they count too
Focus on effort as much as results
Keep a running list to see patterns over time

quests.title: Challenge Conqueror
quests.description: Tackle one task you've been putting off because it seemed difficult. Champions face their dragons.
objectives: Identify one challenging task you've been avoiding
Break it into smaller, manageable steps
Complete at least the first significant step
tips: Start with just 15 minutes if it feels overwhelming
Break big tasks into smaller, specific actions
You're more capable than your doubt tells you

quests.title: Knowledge Seeker
quests.description: Learn something new for 20 minutes in an area that interests you. Curiosity is the engine of achievement.
objectives: Choose a topic that genuinely interests you
Engage with learning material for 20 focused minutes
Take notes or reflect on what you learned
tips: Videos, articles, books - any format works
Teaching someone else helps solidify learning

quests.title: Confidence Architect
quests.description: Do something slightly outside your comfort zone to build confidence. Courage grows through practice.
objectives: Identify something slightly outside your comfort zone
Reflect on how it felt and what you learned
tips: Nerves are normal and show you're growing
Each small brave act builds confidence for bigger ones

quests.title: Excellence Craftsperson
quests.description: Take something you do regularly and find one way to do it better. Excellence is a habit, not a destination.
objectives: Choose a routine task or skill
Research or think of one improvement
tips: Focus on process, not just outcomes
Ask 'How could I do this 10% better?'
